entries.meaning: (chiefly uncountable) Drawings or words drawn on a surface in a public place, usually made without authorization.
examples: The underpass is a popular place for graffiti artists.
The city council spends thousands of pounds removing graffiti from public buildings.

entries.meaning: (archaeology, countable) Informal inscriptions, figure drawings, etc., as opposed to official inscriptions.

verbs.description: graffiti (third-person singular simple present graffitis, present participle graffitiing, simple past and past participle graffitied)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To mark a surface with such images.
